68C00534EEFB42369E113B58B7F8F60F.description:
Create a personal leadership plan to participate in programs, conferences,
community service and competitive events on the local, region, state, and national
level that align with the competencies, skills and knowledge of this course.

D15087F2F81B45589B9BE5432807CBDA.description:
Explain how participation in the state supported healthcare science CTSO can
promote lifelong responsibility for community service and professional growth and
development.

E733D54B4775459CBEE83EA645501F0B.description:
Discuss the mission, purpose, motto, colors, official dress and other distinguishing
characteristic of the state supported healthcare science CTSO.

FE330E50AF814C9281643014238565D5.description:
Research the history of the state supported healthcare science CTSO (Career
Technical Student Organization).

F12D9FA86198417B850B823D28DC0784.description:
Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology
education courses through leadership development, school and community service
projects, entrepreneurship development, and competitive events.

4252008700BD462EA3F6C344700E8CFF.description: Analyze diagrams, charts, graphs, and tables to interpret healthcare results.

830BDAE273A847149B7A96CC19C211A3.description:
Utilize metric and household, conversions and measurements as related to
healthcare procedures and treatments.

8FAA00C0ADE74B2FA98C6F2F6E04E1F1.description: Apply mathematical computations related to healthcare procedures.

6A6CDAF9D40349D08DFE3D471B6E1240.description: Demonstrate use of appropriate email and social media.

889BDD0DE11447D7B6EBE58113ABE511.description: Evaluate the validity of web-based resources.

559DDFCBACDE4CCB98D691505FE443D0.description: Use basic word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications.

D73D6FAB34944F7DB05AEB8688801962.description: Use basic word processing, spreadsheet, and database applications.

7EBBA3BB05D6426B96E93236BF328F14.description: Demonstrate use of basic file organization and information storage.

4FCB0783F9904AFC8BC1210DD6A27BFF.description:
Apply basic computer concepts and terminology in order to use computers and
other mobile devices.

14D45CA5596D47E786555402D2650839.description:
Describe appropriate methods to correct inaccurate information/errors personally
entered into an electronic medical record (EMR).

013BE459DF1746568E1ACEF63FE0387C.description:
Describe the consequences of inappropriate use of health data in terms of
disciplinary action.

404F57FF6CDA4D0D9B7599B7B70FCE23.description:
Identify and apply policies and procedures for access and disclosure of personal
health information.

091A66B6334D4F938394724497D1CED7.description:
Identify legal and regulatory requirements related to the use of personal health
information.

7292866A96BB481299417E171E893468.description: Apply the fundamentals of privacy and confidentiality policies and procedures.

B6E68F7726344F3E96AA4F8B2FBF33A9.description:
Adhere to information systems policies and procedures as required by national,
state, local, and organizational levels.

D0825A5512D74CB29D4A6A7BA589D039.description:
Ensure that documentation in the health record reflects timeliness, completeness,
and accuracy.

A5145886E1CA4BEC97929A370FCD1564.description:
Differentiate between types and content of health records (patient, pharmacy, and
laboratory).

419F63FC966241CAA62147DE998AE0C4.description: Use health record data collection tools (such as input screens, document templates).

95F5E391866B47D99B99E940B3171E4F.description: Identify methods and types of data collected in healthcare.

E1881995599847EB899349C2A5231C0C.description:
Utilize information technology applications required within all career specialties.
Demonstrate use as appropriate to healthcare applications.

A552445695AB45348A985D9A766B58CC.description: Examine the common theories of growth and development (Erickson, Maslow’s).

D52778E4C5A74927A158065A08CDB932.description:
Discuss the social, physical, mental, and spiritual needs throughout the different life
stages.

1E62A89B1C4548DE95ED604F527EEDCE.description: Compare and contrast life stages as it relates to growth and developmental needs.

43CE8BCA94BB49E1BB63CCD1DDF12174.description:
Describe the stages of development from birth to adulthood (i.e. neonatal period,
infancy, childhood, adolescence and puberty, adulthood, and geriatrics).

A7E5BAB5636C4AB2BAA5FEBF95894814.description:
Successfully complete CPR, AED, and First Aid training according to American
Heart Association or American Red Cross, or other nationally recognized certifying
agency.

B73C2E97FBF7458E825674BCDBE319F1.description:
Demonstrate how to locate pulse points and how to check pulse and respiratory
rates.

324B3BF1663549D4BFDFC8054E5FD67A.description:
Discuss the function of the respiratory and circulatory systems and what happens
with these systems during cardiac arrest and then during cardiopulmonary
resuscitation.

8330862A0CBE42328F63114350D99A4F.description: Analyze differences in pulse and respiratory rates in adult, child and infant.

A7CF4DFCC4A14DD9B240002EF45E65D3.description: Demonstrate CPR, First Aid and the AED utilizing current standards.

776AEE3DE4DD40C4A0714B7A82A1F54A.description: Discuss immunizations and the schedule for vaccinations.

D36D716D292F4D38AF13F861A34366D5.description: Discuss Hospital Acquired Infection (HAI), the HAI standards and reporting of HAI.

A27495474E7F4CCE8F2A24618CB31B66.description: Describe methods of controlling the spread and growth of microorganisms.

A2409FD6C78A41A88EB5B0B5CF4E4A8D.description:
Utilize personal protective equipment (PPE) and apply personal safety procedures
based on OSHA (Occupational Health and Safety Administration and the Centers
for Disease Control and Prevention (CDCP).

F316690098664A60AA3E1030A5322220.description: Analyze ways microorganisms are spread using the chain of infection model.

F2786B1B3C724597B2C928F33179008E.description: Examine the evolution and spread of antibiotic resistant pathogens.

8A21B050396C4A9D82B0BD15CB53CF8F.description:
Compare and demonstrate various physical (hand washing and PPE) and chemical
methods (cleaning, disinfection, and sterilization) used to control or prevent
microbial growth.

0DF49E9DAB2D44D3871270924BE9DC77.description:
Define and describe the need for asepsis and infection prevention in the classroom,
laboratory, and in the healthcare environment.

A997D36969AF44189B38749372F490C7.description:
Analyze different types of microorganisms and their defining characteristics to reduce
the risk of infection or illness. Demonstrate physicochemical methods and the use of
PPE in preventing and controlling the spread of microbial growth.

3185DD82A5B04678AD681DFC8038C66E.description: Describe strategies to maintain a healthy lifestyle.

4ABB0A8B97C44B339B85AECB36FF94A4.description: Apply behaviors that promote health and wellness.

C014CF2C36354BAD9E04AB4B39E40726.description: Practice preventive health behaviors personally and professionally.

E7FE0DCBD8E749339D812EECCF13A08E.description: Recognize legal and ethical implications of electronic communications.

B8760BE65ABA40898A54187D6129E550.description:
Utilize current and acceptable medical abbreviations and terminology within the
electronic medical record and in other forms of medical communication.

365FA796D18241A5BC516C51E1C69767.description: Use roots, prefixes, and suffixes to communicate information.

58C02BA398734114AD9F30767925A349.description:
Recognize elements of written and electronic communication (spelling, grammar,
and formatting).

CE4DEAC178A5486C9E7B8FE65F5F3EC3.description: Apply speaking and active listening skills.

D1D671D560904ECB9E7EFACBE8E70A36.description: Recognize the elements of communication using a sender-receiver model.

994AC52404D843E7A8B1CF329FD86EBE.description:
Identify and demonstrate the various methods of providing and obtaining information
from patients, family members, other agencies, and other members of the healthcare
team.

D2928E9903E5499BB3DFE83C7878A0DC.description: Evaluate the importance of institutional policies and procedures.

307B099948AF4AFF8A865250CCDB5050.description: Explain standards for Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA).

FDC75398E0D04C81925C6C2F132AC712.description:
Analyze the basic legal responsibilities of healthcare workers in regards to torts,
malpractice, and negligence, invasion of privacy, privileged communication,
patient/client confidentiality, and informed consent.

FFBBB6A86CA2435B9DED01927194642B.description:
Analyze the basic legal responsibilities of healthcare workers in regards to torts,
malpractice, and negligence, invasion of privacy, privileged communication,
patient/client confidentiality, and informed consent.

5086A13E6AAF40F197AA38E827E979ED.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of the legal responsibilities, limitations, and implications
of their actions within the healthcare delivery setting. Evaluate the importance of their
duties according to regulations, policies, laws and legislated rights of clients.

52E9DE2B20F14ADB835E3778BF99ED19.description:
Demonstrate respectful and empathetic treatment of ALL patients/clients
(patient/customer service).

71206600F8844C47B43AE4DCBF377B1C.description: Examine ethical dilemmas that may occur in healthcare.

211AF45FAD7848698C79CC31A0EE28F6.description: Recognize ethical issues and their implications related to healthcare.

DD880B269C4E488C86E8F3D4D1E861B9.description: Compare and contrast personal and workplace ethics.

1729C7FDFCCC4875B752FB83CC8734A5.description: Evaluate how diversity affects healthcare delivery.

C4E46E064E0949F6A0F6CE1B8E26ACEA.description: Evaluate the impact of diversity and ethics on healthcare delivery.

26757370E9594EACBB8549479C0EB3EA.description: Identify and develop entrepreneurial opportunities in healthcare.

E7E8894C7DD641109B46AE31E405F0CC.description: Apply effective techniques for managing team conflict.

6F333C725A114B9BBE30C38427E0653E.description: Analyze attributes and attitudes of an effective leader.

7BE3837D421143EBACD72D881DD9BD4D.description: Recognize methods for building positive team relationships and communication.

DEA528DD671B43B0A077DA10CC1673FB.description: Discuss complementary health practices and career opportunities.

A3DC0EC7CFFA477E84C4B662AE40521E.description:
Analyze the roles and responsibilities of individual members as part of the health
care team, including their ability to promote the delivery of quality health care.

576E2EF6FD934AE9AE783E6F8A9AB624.description: Analyze personal career goals and develop a career plan.

B2D7FB6E7AE8432C886A966D09EF2CFB.description:
Discuss levels of education, credentialing requirements, and employment trends in
healthcare.

3E68C2EC7CFD49F7AD754378562CA7BD.description:
Compare careers within the health science career pathways: therapeutic, diagnostic,
health informatics, environmental support, and biotechnology research and
development.

3BE9846F7065491793262A7ED5639CB6.description: Discuss common methods of payment for healthcare.

7A312EE7454F45189943853C0209F3AE.description:
Explain the impact of emerging issues such as technology, epidemiology, bioethics,
and socioeconomics on healthcare delivery systems.

18416D5467084528861DD19923F9AC1C.description:
Describe the responsibilities of consumers within the healthcare system and how to
engage patients and families in their own healthcare.

3CCF2F3223464AA8B2E7C41FCFD5BD56.description: Evaluate the factors influencing healthcare delivery systems.

B83979E53DDC4ECEBB5F160F174803ED.description: Analyze the healthcare delivery system (public, private, government, and non-profit).

B4F0A99C538F47AB9CDC258F5AFFDB42.description:
Describe how various healthcare roles fit into the office/department, the organization
and the overall health care environment. Identify how key systems affect services
performed and quality of care.

76C23FD350584C47AADF438E6C3DF8D0.description:
Utilize personal protective equipment (PPE) and apply personal safety procedures
based on OSHA (Occupational Health and Safety Administration and the Centers
for Disease Control and Prevention (CDCP).

075395400B2241619E7178B2EE353696.description:
Explain the following agencies’ role in healthcare practice: OSHA, CDCP, CLIA,
FDA, and ISO.

74181E8D39804EEF988FAD15CD0EF2BB.description:
Apply basic Emergency procedures and protocol in basic emergency situations and
events.

3470F068DC6D4DC8B04BD9DBCA559367.description:
Analyze the role and the responsibilities of the healthcare provider (student) in the
classroom, laboratory, and various workplace settings in an emergency situation.

ED8F7D4D329A492CAF7A4F2E2F0B3BD2.description: Comply with safety signs, symbols and labels.

17D4F4A5FF6B4CD78D485D940F32B976.description: Identify safety hazards and reduce risk associated with them.

A6C21DD6662D4E81834DA012CEA48B9D.description:
Demonstrate standard safety practices for all classroom, laboratory and field
experiences. Understand the existing and potential hazards to clients, co-workers, and
self, and prevent injury or illness through safe work practices by following current
health and safety policies and procedures.

A0C97F6529734336A4B296E9958616F5.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

8152BBF4178D418AB74068C6B5BF6863.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse
workplace to be able to work independently and apply team work skills.

D4BE262388B84FEABC990B5376BBACC2.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity,
honesty, accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

A29C853C0972424B921BD6BFBCD3F399.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

8E3F80DC562C4AD28CCB651169B1FC73.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures
and methods.

F51E73A28D344C62B96C6391952ED8B4.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

3DDB9C69FAF74107991E9205317D24EE.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
